column4: Why, if i sudo apt-get install traceroute, does it still say command not found?
locate traceroute and see what it says.
Well, now I get a weird error.
traceroute: icmp socket: Operation not permitted
I can run it as sudo.
I can ping as non-root, just not traceroute.
Can you "ls -l /etc/alternatives/traceroute" and tell me the ownership of the file?
I would assume you apt-get install traceroute-nanog instead of traceroute?
Hmm. I removed that and it works, thanks.
No problem.  I actually don't know what the -nanog variant does :P
